SENT.plain: Artifacts that mimic malignancy may lead to diagnostic difficulty and can cause serious consequences
We present 2 cases received in consultation which demonstrated peculiar artifacts that closely mimicked carcinoma
In case 1, contaminating products of conception were confused with squamous cell carcinoma
In case 2, artifactual signet ring cells induced by procedural trauma were suspicious for signet ring cell carcinoma
In both cases, clinical correlation failed to completely exclude carcinoma, and limited tissue prevented use of ancillary studies
Our final resolution of these artifacts required lengthy and detailed morphologic analysis
